zclOTAUCluster.h File Reference

The header file describes the OTAU cluster interface. ZigBee Document 095264r17. Revision 17 Version 0.7 March 14, 2010. More...

#include <zcl.h>
#include <clusters.h>
#include <ofdExtMemory.h>

Enumerations

enum  ZCL_OtauAction_t {
  OTAU_SERVER_HAS_BEEN_FOUND, OTAU_SERVER_HAS_NOT_BEEN_FOUND, OTAU_SERVER_HAS_BEEN_LOST, OTAU_OFD_DRIVER_ERROR,
  OTAU_SERVER_RECEIVED_MALFORMED_COMMAND, OTAU_SERVER_NO_IMAGE_AVAILABLE, OTAU_SERVER_RECEIVED_UNSUPPORTED_COMMAND, OTAU_SERVER_RECEIVED_UNKNOWN_STATUS,
  OTAU_SERVER_IS_NOT_AUTHORIZED_TO_UPDATE, OTAU_DOWNLOAD_STARTED, OTAU_DOWNLOAD_ABORTED, OTAU_DOWNLOAD_FINISHED,
  OTAU_DEVICE_SHALL_CHANGE_IMAGE, OTAU_ISD_IMAGE_CACHE_IS_FOUND, OTAU_ISD_HARDWARE_FAULT, OTAU_ISD_COMMUNICATION_LOST,
  OTAU_MAX_MESSAGE_NUMBER
}
enum  ZCL_OtauZigbeeStackVersion_t {
  OTAU_ZB_STACK_VERSION_2006 = 0x0000, OTAU_ZB_STACK_VERSION_2007 = 0x0001, OTAU_ZB_STACK_VERSION_PRO = 0x0002, OTAU_ZB_STACK_VERSION_IP = 0x0003,
  OTAU_FAKE_VERSION = 0xFFFF
}
enum  ZCL_OtauImageType_t {

  OTAU_WILD_CARD_TYPE = 0xFFFF
}

 Checks whether OTAU cluster is busy or not.
bool ZCL_UnsolicitedUpgradeEndResp (ZCL_Addressing_t *addressing, ZCL_OtauUpgradeEndResp_t *resp)
 The server may send an unsolicited Upgrade End Response command to the client. This may be used for example if the server wants to synchronize the upgrade on multiple clients simultaneously.

Detailed Description

The header file describes the OTAU cluster interface. ZigBee Document 095264r17. Revision 17 Version 0.7 March 14, 2010.

Author:
Atmel Corporation: http://www.atmel.com
Support email: avr@atmel.com

Copyright (c) 2008-2011, Atmel Corporation. All rights reserved. Licensed under Atmel's Limited License Agreement (BitCloudTM).

Definition at line 94 of file zclOTAUCluster.h.

#define OTAU_CLUSTER_ZCL_SERVER_CLUSTER_TYPE (   clattributes,
  clcommands 
)
Value:
{                                                                           \
    .id = OTAU_CLUSTER_ID,                                                    \
    .options = {                                                              \
      .type = ZCL_SERVER_CLUSTER_TYPE,                                        \
      .security = ZCL_DEFAULT_CLUSTER_SECURITY,                               \
      .ackRequest = 1,                                                        \
      .reserved = 0},                                                         \
    .attributesAmount = ZCL_OTAU_CLUSTER_SERVER_ATTRIBUTES_AMOUNT,            \
    .attributes = (uint8_t *) clattributes,                                   \
    .commandsAmount = ZCL_OTAU_CLUSTER_COMMANDS_AMOUNT,                       \
    .commands = (uint8_t *) clcommands                                        \
  }

ZCL OTAU Cluster server side defining macros.

Parameters:
attributes- pointer to cluster server attributes (ZCL_OtauClusterClientAttributes_t) or NULL if there are no attributes
clcommands- pointer to cluster server commands or NULL if there are no commands
Returns:
None

ZCL OTAU Cluster client side defining macros.

Parameters:

clcommands- pointer to cluster client commands or NULL if there are no commands

Function Documentation

ZCL_Cluster_t ZCL_GetOtauClientCluster ( void  )

Gets Otau's cluster.

Returns:
Otau's client cluster
ZCL_Cluster_t ZCL_GetOtauServerCluster ( void  )

Gets Otau's cluster.

Returns:
Otau's server cluster
ZCL_Status_t ZCL_StartOtauService ( ZCL_OtauInitParams_t *  pInitParam,
ZCL_OtauStatInd_t  ind 
)

OTAU parametres initialization. Start server discovery procedure on client side or start server.

Parameters:
[in]pInitParam- pointer to init structure.
[in]ind- indication for OTAU actions
("ind" can be NULL if indication is not required.)
Returns:
Service status
ZCL_Status_t ZCL_StopOtauService ( ZCL_OtauInitParams_t *  pInitParam)

Stop OTAU service. (It is not implemented for client)

Parameters:
[in]pInitParam- pointer to init structure.
Returns:
Service status
bool zclIsOtauBusy ( void  )

Checks whether OTAU cluster is busy or not.

Returns:
true - if OTAU cluster is busy, false - otherwise.
bool ZCL_UnsolicitedUpgradeEndResp ( ZCL_Addressing_t *  addressing,
ZCL_OtauUpgradeEndResp_t *  resp 
)

The server may send an unsolicited Upgrade End Response command to the client. This may be used for example if the server wants to synchronize the upgrade on multiple clients simultaneously.

Parameters:
[in]addressing- pointer to structure with addressing information;
[in]resp- pointer to upgrade end response payload
Returns:
true - data is sending, false - server is busy.
